pull.title: docs: fix various misleading comments
pull.body: Came across a few misleading comments, wanted to fix them

events.body:
ACK 268965da59bb35083faa4e697bfab3e9b53efbfd

Definitely improvements, but I've added one suggestion. I also agree with Marco about not documenting all of the chains in chainparams.h.

Concept ACK.

Agree with @MarcoFalke's suggestion. Could squash into one commit. A couple of minor suggestions.

events.message:
[doc] GetBestBlock() doesn't do nothing

This has tripped people up multiple times because it looks like
GetBestBlock is a const function returning the value of hashBlock.

[doc] correct comment in chainparams

There are more than 3 networks.

[doc] correct comment about ATMPW

ATMPW stands for AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker, which was removed in #16400.

events.body: Thanks for the reviews, took everyone's suggestions!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,8 +64,9 @@ struct ChainTxData {
 
 /**
  * CChainParams defines various tweakable parameters of a given instance of the
- * Bitcoin system. There are three: the main network on which people trade goods
- * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time and
+ * Bitcoin system. There are four: the main network on which people trade goods
+ * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time,
+ * a signet test network with extra block requirements (see BIP325) and
  * a regression test mode which is intended for private networks only. It has
  * minimal difficulty to ensure that blocks can be found instantly.
comments.body: nit: It might be better to move the explanation of each network to where each network is defined

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,8 +64,9 @@ struct ChainTxData {
 
 /**
  * CChainParams defines various tweakable parameters of a given instance of the
- * Bitcoin system. There are three: the main network on which people trade goods
- * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time and
+ * Bitcoin system. There are four: the main network on which people trade goods
+ * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time,
+ * a signet test network with extra block requirements (see BIP325) and
  * a regression test mode which is intended for private networks only. It has
  * minimal difficulty to ensure that blocks can be found instantly.
comments.body: Agree. Better not to enumerate things here which can be documented where they're defined.

- * Bitcoin system. There are three: the main network on which people trade goods
- * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time and

comments.body:
```suggestion
 * and services, the public test network which is reset from time to time,
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,8 +64,9 @@ struct ChainTxData {
 
 /**
  * CChainParams defines various tweakable parameters of a given instance of the
- * Bitcoin system. There are three: the main network on which people trade goods
- * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time and
+ * Bitcoin system. There are four: the main network on which people trade goods
+ * and services, the public test network which gets reset from time to time,
+ * a signet test network with extra block requirements (see BIP325) and
  * a regression test mode which is intended for private networks only. It has
  * minimal difficulty to ensure that blocks can be found instantly.
comments.body: Not sure here. I think there can be value in listing short descriptions in one place to have an overview. A more detailed description would belong with the individual chains, sure.

comments.body: Ah oops I didn't see this comment! I suppose the issue with listing them here is that people might forget to update it, which is exactly what happened
